alert.note: Alert for Chattahoochee; Marion; Stewart; Webster (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 04 at 3:25AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Marion, southeastern Chattahoochee, Stewart and northwestern Webster Counties through 400 AM EST... At 325 AM EST, a strong thunderstorm was near Providence Canyon State Park, or 7 miles northwest of Lumpkin, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Lumpkin, Buena Vista, Cusseta, Richland, Brantley, Seminole, Charles, Christopher, Brooklyn, Renfroe, Draneville, Manta, Zellobee, Omaha, Sanford, Church Hill, Louvale and Providence Canyon State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
